newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Fosters says expects to buy Molson stake.
newsitem.headline: Fosters says expects to buy Molson stake.

text.p: Foster's Brewing Group Ltd said on Thursday it expected Philip Morris Cos Inc to sell its 20 percent stake in Canada's Molson Breweries to both Foster's and Molson Cos Ltd.
Foster's and Molson Cos have an option to buy the Philip Morris stake, held by subsidiary Millers Brewing, on a 50-50 basis.
"I would expect that will eventually go through but it's not only up to us -- but my expectation is that we will see that," Foster's Chairman John Ralph told reporters.
"If that deal is finally consummated, Molson (Cos) would have the other 10 percent," he said.
Molson said on June 18 that the buy-back talks were at a fairly advanced stage but would not reveal price details.
Molson and Foster's each own 40 percent of Molson Breweries.

Foster's and Molson Cos each sold 10 percent of Molson Breweries, Canada's largest brewer, to Miller in 1993 but the sale proved to be a major and costly headache for Molson Breweries and its shareholders.
The sale was found to breach the conditions of a licencing agreement with Miller's U.S. rival, Adolph Coors Co, with Moslon settling the dispute for C$100 million.
